definitions: To get hold of; to gain possession of, to procure; to acquire, in any way.
To secure (that) a specific objective or state of affairs be reached.
To prevail, be victorious; to succeed.
To hold; to keep, possess or occupy.
To exist or be the case; to hold true, be in force.
To damage beyond use or repair.
To neutralize, undo a property or condition.
To put down or euthanize.
To severely disrupt the well-being of (a person); ruin.
To defeat soundly.
To remove data.
To sing a song poorly.
(antiphrasis) To exhaust duly and thus recreate or build up.
To penetrate sexually in an aggressive way.
A heavy yellow elemental metal of great value, with atomic number 79 and symbol Au.
A coin or coinage made of this material, or supposedly so.
A deep yellow colour, resembling the metal gold.
The bullseye of an archery target.
A gold medal.
Anything or anyone that is very valuable.
(in the plural) A grill (jewellery worn on front teeth) made of gold.
Arousing suspicion.
Distrustful or tending to suspect.
Expressing suspicion
Profound knowledge, especially that based on learning and scholarship.
Arrogant conduct; insulting, bold behaviour or attitude.

The highest or the greatest point of something.
The moment of greatest success, expansion, etc.
The topmost vertex of a cone or pyramid (in their conventional orientation).
The "pointed" fine end of something.
The end of a leaf, petal or similar organ opposed to the end where it is attached to its support; the tip.
The point on the celestial sphere toward which the sun appears to move relative to nearby stars.
The lowest point on a pendant drop of a liquid.
The end or edge of a vein nearest the surface.
A diacritic in Classical Latin that resembles and gave rise to the acute.
A diacritic in Middle Vietnamese that indicates /ŋ͡m/.
A sharp upward point formed by two strokes that meet at an acute angle, as in "W", uppercase "A", and closed-top "4", or by a tapered stroke, as in lowercase "t".
The top of the food chain
Impossible to prevent or stop; inevitable.
Unable to be persuaded; relentless; unrelenting.
Adamant; severe.
Out of place, incompatible, inharmonious, not congruent
Of or relating to two numbers that have different remainders when divided by a third number
Lack of sophistication, experience, judgement or worldliness; artlessness; gullibility; credulity.
A behavior or way of thinking that is characteristic of a person.

A peculiar individual reaction to a generally innocuous substance or factor.
A peculiarity that serves to distinguish or identify.
To surround or hem in.
(sometimes figurative) To attack or assail, especially from all sides.

Of a ship, to get trapped by ice.
Not savory; without flavor.
Of bad taste; distasteful.
Making an activity undesirable.
Disreputable, not respectable, of questionable moral character.
To plunder, pillage, rob, pirate, or remove.
To deprive (a person) of something through theft or violence.
Having the same or very similar nature, personality, tastes, habits or interests.
Friendly or sociable.
Suitable to one’s needs.
A tiny opening in the skin.

To deprive of nerve, force, or strength; to weaken; to enfeeble.
To make somebody nervous, upset, alarm, shake the resolve of.
A cuckoo.
A fool; a simpleton; a stupid or clumsy person.
Grasp, envelopment, control.

Various similar units in other systems.
Depth of insight, mental reach or scope.
Of or pertaining to an omen or to omens; being or exhibiting an omen; significant.
Specifically, giving indication of a coming ill; being an evil omen
To compose fables; hence, to write or speak fiction; to write or utter what is not true.
To make up; to devise, and speak of, as true or real; to tell of falsely; to recount in the form of a fable.
The act of flourishing or waving.
Possessed of great wrath; very angry.
A short flash of light.
A feeling of being displeased with something or someone; dissatisfaction; disapproval.
That which displeases; cause of irritation or annoyance; offence; injury.
A state of disgrace or disfavour.
Large and impressive, in size, scope or extent
Pompous or pretentious
One fully skilled or well versed in anything; a proficient
Realisation or understanding of the significance and nature of events after they have occurred

That which is void or empty.
Emotionally hardened; unfeeling and indifferent to the suffering/feelings of others.
Having calluses.
(often plurale tantum) Distant and close relatives, collectively; kin.
(often plurale tantum) People of the same ethnic descent, not including speaker; brethren.
A grouping of relatives.
Blood relationship.
Affinity, likeness.

To walk with long steps.
To stand with the legs wide apart; to straddle.

A reprehensible person; a villain.
A sharp or witty reply, or one which turns an argument against its originator; a comeback.

A fixed look; a look of eagerness, wonder, or admiration; a continued look of attention.
The object gazed on.

Disdainfully or ironically humorous.

To turn or open slightly; to become ajar or to cause to become ajar; to be or to hang ajar.

To become widespread.
Done or kept in secret, sometimes to conceal an illicit or improper purpose.

Nimble; limber.

Insubstantial.

A strong intuition that something is about to happen (usually something negative, but not exclusively).

To imagine; to invent; to pretend.

An involuntary trembling, sometimes an effect of paralysis, but usually caused by terror or fear; quaking; quivering.
A libration of the starry sphere in the Ptolemaic system; a motion ascribed to the firmament, to account for certain small changes in the position of the ecliptic and of the stars.
Keeping one's thoughts and opinions to oneself; reserved or restrained.
Hesitant or not wanting to take some action; reluctant (usually followed by a verb in the infinitive).
Without peer or equal; unparalleled, nonpareil. Of the highest quality, best.

Succinctness; conciseness.
A short piece of writing.
An esoteric doctrine or treatise; esoteric philosophy.
One who believes, or is an initiate, in esoteric doctrines or rites.
An outdoor facility for urination and defecation, whether open (latrine) or enclosed (outhouse).
A lavatory: a room with a toilet.
A toilet: a fixture used for urination and defecation.
A partaker; one having an interest in an action, contract, etc. to which he is not himself a party.
Understood by only a few.

Requiring secret or mysterious knowledge to understand.
Extremely old (e.g. interpretation or knowledge), and possibly irrelevant.
Blood colour; red.
Anything of a blood-red colour, as cloth.
A tincture, seldom used, of a blood-red colour (not to be confused with murrey).

Red crayon.
Causing great horror or terror.

An example, or typical instance.

To detest, hate, revile.

To converge.
In a cordial, warm or friendly manner.

Anything that revives or comforts.

examples: Hooligans destroy unprovoked.
Smoking destroys the natural subtlety of the palate.
Destroying a rabid dog is required by law.
Her divorce destroyed her; she had a nervous breakdown and was severely depressed for more than a year.
The memory leak happened because we forgot to destroy the temporary lists.
This exercise is going to destroy all parts of your shoulders.
She got destroyed by her lover on the carpet.
France has won three golds and five silvers.

I have a suspicious attitude to get-rich-quick schemes.
She gave me a suspicious look.

the apex of civilization
